3. Incontinence refers to the loss of bladder control, which can be a symptom of various neurological conditions.
4. Visual hallucinations are the perception of visual stimuli that are not actually present in the environment.
5. Right-sided weakness refers to weakness or paralysis of the muscles on the right side of the body.
6. Diffuse cerebral vasospasm refers to a sudden constriction of blood vessels in the brain, which can lead to a decrease in blood flow and oxygen supply to the brain.
